TopicTitle: why wont my service module work?

Articles.Content: My service module is not feeding my engine even though I put fuel tanks in there. There is only one thing that works and it was the fuel duct but the Munar 1 mission does not have that. I tried testing some new things in sandbox mode but nothing worked (it was just the service module, engine, and the command pod).

If you are referring to the SM-25, it's been broken for a while.  Been a known bug, but Squad hasn't fixed it for several updates now.  When originally released, it did work but a few versions later it changed to its current behavior of needing a fuel duct.
Stick a fuel line from the tank to the engine.  That worked for me.
Specifically, place a fuel duct between the side of the tank and the inside floor of the SM25. That will connect the fuel flow to the engine.

On 4/9/2020 at 2:54 PM, Cavscout74 said:

If you are referring to the SM-25, it's been broken for a while.  Been a known bug, but Squad hasn't fixed it for several updates now.  When originally released, it did work but a few versions later it changed to its current behavior of needing a fuel duct.

Yep, I think it still doesn't work. @SQUAD, has this been fixed yet?
